clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Multiple Component Training Program on Muscles in Adults With Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Multiple Component Training Program on Muscles, Maximal Muscle Strength, Endurance and Functional Performance in Adults With Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1: A Pilot Study

collaborator.agency: Fondation du Grand défi Pierre Lavoie

brief_summary.textblock: A strength and endurance training program was conducted in adults with myotonic dystrophy type 1 (DM1). Participants underwent a 12-week/18-session supervised training program consisted of 6 exercises: elbow flexion/extension, shoulder horizontal adduction, leg press, and knee flexion/extension. To offer a complete training program aimed at improving function it was divided: the first 6 weeks were dedicated to strength-training, whereas the following weeks focused on endurance-training. To evaluate the effects of the training program, participants completed maximal strength, endurance and functional evaluations. Volunteers could also add a muscle biopsy at the beginning and the end of the program to evaluate physiological parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in maximal muscle strength in the knee extensors measured by quantified muscle testing
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
primary_outcome.description: Changes in knee extensor maximal muscle strength evaluated by quantified muscle testing with a handheld dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 6 minute walking test disance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: Walking endurance change measured by the 6 minute walking test distance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in functional capacity measured by the UQAM-YMCA test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: Functional capacity evaluated by 18 functional tests

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in sprint capacity measured by the Running-base anaerobic sprint test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: Sprint capacity changes measured by the running-base anaerobic sprint test

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in fatigue measured by the Fatigue severity scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue questionnaire: 9-item questionnaire rated on a scale from 1 to 7 for each item. A score a higher score means more fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in daytime sleepiness measured by the Daytime sleepiness scale (Epworth Sleepiness Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: 8-item questionnaire, rated on a scale from 0 to 3 for each item, the higher the score, the more the patient has daytime sleepiness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in stumbles and falls measured by the Falls efficacy scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: 10-item questionnaire about stumbles and falls. All items are rated on a 10-point scale. A higher score means a higher fear of falling. A score over 70 means a significant fear of falling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in quality of life measured by the 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: 36-item quality of life questionnaire. The final score is calculated on a total of 100 where the lower the score, the more disability. A score of 100 means no disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in life habits measured by questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program
secondary_outcome.description: Life habits questionnaire Assessment of life habits is a 77-item questionnaire with a scale from 0 to 9 for each item. A higher score means no disability and a low score means more disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in muscle biopsy-muscle fiber size
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program for volunteers
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in muscle fiber size

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in muscle biopsy-muscle fiber typing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program for volunteers
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in muscle fiber typing

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in muscle biopsy-proportion of centrally nuclated fibers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program for volunteers
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in muscle centrally nucleated fibers proportion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 12-week training program for volunteers
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in muscle fiber leucocyte infiltration

intervention.description: 12-week, 18-session training program. To offer a complete training program aimed at improving function it was divided : the first 6 weeks were dedicated to strength-training (2 sets of 6 repetitions at 80% of 1-RM), whereas the following weeks focused on endurance-training (1 set of 25 repetitions at 40% of 1-RM).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with DM1
- Walk without technical aid
- Muscle impairment rating scale (MIRS) of 3 or 4
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe musculoskeletal disorders
- Any medical contraindication to physical exercise
- Any medical contraindication to muscle biopsies for the biopsy volunteers
